text: Philip Tartaglia (11 January 1951 â€“ 13 January 2021) was a Scottish prelate who served as a bishop of the Catholic Church. He was the Metropolitan Archbishop of Glasgow from 2012 to 2021. He was the Bishop of Paisley from 2005 to 2012. Tartaglia was born in Glasgow, Scotland. Tartaglia died on 13 January 2021 at his home in Glasgow from COVID-19 at the age of 70. ==References== Category:1951 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in the United Kingdom Category:Roman Catholic bishops Category:People from Glasgow
title: Philip Tartaglia
